location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire to Captain Charles Sealy, Commander of the HC Cruizer Ternateand Senior Marine Officer, Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns a batilla (a small sea going vessel) abandoned in Kharrack bay [Bandar-e Chārak], and captured by the British Squadron in the Gulf; the vessel is believed by the British to have been on a piratical expedition to the coast of Africa.It includes instructions indicating that the Captain should make arrangements for the batilla to be returned to Sharga [Sharjah], so that Soultan bin Sugger [Sulṭān bin Saqr] can identify it, its owners, and therefore punish any offenders.
